alert.note: Alert for Allamakee; Winneshiek (Iowa) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS LaCrosse (Southwestern Wisconsin, Southeastern Minnesota, and Northeast Iowa)
info.headline: Flash Flood Warning issued August 27 at 8:20PM CDT until August 27 at 11:30PM CDT by NWS LaCrosse
info.description: The National Weather Service in La Crosse has issued a * Flash Flood Warning for... Southwestern Allamakee County in northeastern Iowa... Southeastern Winneshiek County in northeastern Iowa... * Until 1130 PM CDT. * At 820 PM CDT, Doppler radar indicated thunderstorms producing heavy rain across the warned area. Between 2 and 3 inches of rain have fallen. Additional rainfall amounts of 1 to 2 inches are possible in the warned area. Flash flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly. HAZARD...Flash flooding caused by thunderstorms. SOURCE...Radar. IMPACT...Flash flooding of small creeks and streams, urban areas, highways, streets and underpasses as well as other poor drainage and low-lying areas. * Some locations that will experience flash flooding include... Decorah, Waukon, Postville, Ossian, Hardin, Castalia, Ludlow, Frankville, Glenwood Church, State Road 51 And County W 48, State Road 9 And Frankville Road, County Roads A 52 And W 60, County Road W 46 And Centennial Road, State Road 76 And County X 16, County Roads X 16 And B 38 and State Road 9 And County X 20. FLASH FLOOD...RADAR INDICATED
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
